comment:
Nose: sweet, light peat
Palette: light, honey, vanilla
Finish: smooth

The Ardmore founded by wm. Teachers and sons. One of the best malts I have had. Peety and smokey. 
A brilliant malt by my standards.
Light peat. Warm and a bit of spice.  Surprised at how smooth and enjoyable it is.
'Lightly peated', burns the tip of the tongue.
A good Highland with a touch of peat. I don’t if it’s available in the States. My Glasgow friend gave it to me.
Really didnt like the peaty taste of this

Nose: Mossy peat smoke, ripe and sweet green apple, butterscotch, melted caramel, charred oak/bonfire, some citrus (lemon rind), hint of candied orange, hint of black olives, some honey and berries (blackberries, cranberries), damp and old smoky wood, small hint of candied bacon, a little ripe tangerine, a hint of pine, tiny note of burnt matchsticks/sulphur, a small note reminiscent of sherry, light vegetal note, sweet smokiness, faintest chlorine note, slight vanilla, some dried fruit (raisins, cranberries, prune), apricot jam

Palate: Some red apple, caramel, a bit of tar and wood char, soft grassy peat, some sea saltiness and brine, a mild marshmallow note, wood bitterness and barrel tannins, a brief and light creaminess, dried fruit/raisin, herbal bitterness, a bit of black pepper, some barley sugar and maltiness, a hint of anice, some sweet iodine, some anjou pear

Finish: Medium strength peaty smoke, oak spice, apricot and nectarine, herbal bitterness, herbal smoke, bonfire smoke

Colour: Straw
Nose: Light Oak, Mild spice
Taste: Watered down Oak, little peat, little vanilla. 

A very thin Whisky with little bite.
